title: Schematics and PCB Design Task  for IOT Sensor - Upwork
description: CONTROL BOARD REQUIREMENTS * The dimensions of the Control Board should be 24x40mm. * It should have a minimum of 4-6 mounting holes. * The locations of the elements on the placement diagram should be as indicated as much as possible on the PCB. * All materials used on the PCB should be selected from Digikey. * A 3.6V battery will be used for battery operation. * The input voltage for External Power usage will be between 4-32V. * Low Power requirements should be considered in the design. * The selected materials must be able to operate within a minimum temperature range of -40 ~ 85°C. * A Hall Effect sensor will be used to wake the device from sleep. Approval should be obtained when selecting the sensor. A product similar to AH1815-W-7 can be chosen. The selected product should have a magnetic detection threshold greater than 20mT. * MDBT50Q-1MV2/MDBT50Q-U1MV2 modules will be used as the control units. * RGB LED pins should be connected to the PWM pins of MDBT50Q. * A 1.25mm Molex 2-pin or similar product should be used for the Battery Connector. * The NFC antenna connector from nRF52840-DK should be used for the NFC antenna connector. * The IO Connector should use the product: Amphenol FCI SFW16R-1STE1LF. * The SPI (CS, MISO, MOSI, CLK), PDM/I2S (DATA, CLK), 2xADC input, 3xDigital Input, 2xSensor Power, and GND pins should be connected to the IO connector. * SMD-type materials should be selected for the PCB, and they should be as small as possible. * When Sensor-1 and Sensor-2 power blocks are active, each channel should be able to deliver a minimum of 250mA of current. * If possible, Battery and External Power Blocks can be combined. * The power consumption of the battery measurement block should be minimized when no battery measurement is being conducted. * The PCB should be able to be powered from the Debug/programming connector. Reset, SWO, SWDIO, SWCLK, VDD, and VSS pins should be accessible via this connector. * The Winbond W25N01GW model or the 64Mb version used in the nRF52840-DK development kit can be used as the Quad Flash. One of them can be preferred considering factors such as price, power consumption, and performance usage advantages. It is necessary to provide information on why the preferred product is chosen. title: ESP32 ULP coprocessor firmware - Upwork
description: Looking for ESP32 developer that has experience with ESP32-WROOM-32 microcontroller and its ULP coprocessor. Firmware implementation is required in Arduino IDE, target Arduino Core 2.0.4 (stable release). There will be used ulptool from Github user duff2013. Easy implementation I will be able to change later. The goal is to have ESP32 main CPU in deep sleep and it will be possible to wake it up using ULP coprocessor only. Coprocessor itself will execute its code once per 15 minutes and will perform measurement using ultrasonic distance sensor. After measurement is performed, it will wake up the main PCB and will pass these data to the main ESP32 CPU using RTC_SLOW memory. Coprocessor needs to use 2 RTC_GPIO pins for HC-SR04 (or any other such as JSN-SR04T) sensor with Trigger and Echo signals. Basically pseudo code, ULP coprocessor needs to execute:   trigPin = RTC_GPIO_XX echoPin = RTC_GPIO_XY   pinMode(trigPin, OUTPUT);   pinMode(echoPin, INPUT);   digitalWrite(trigPin, HIGH);   delayMicroseconds(10); //10 uS pulse   digitalWrite(trigPin, LOW);   duration = pulseIn(echoPin, HIGH); //count milliseconds until on that pin is HIGH, timeout 1 second, if nothing measured, save 0 and pass this data to the main CPU   distance = duration * 0.034 / 2;Skills: ESP32, Firmware, Arduino, Firmware Programming, Embedded System, Assembler, Assembly Language

title: Full Time Remote Assistant For Real Estate Agent / Entrepreneur - Upwork
description: I need a right-hand man/woman to help organize, manage, and grow my real estate business (and other online businesses). I’m a busy real estate agent in the United States looking for a full-time virtual assistant. I’m becoming too busy so I need someone to help manage transactions, respond to leads, do some social media marketing, and more. I’m in the Central Time Zone in the United States which is GMT-5 or GMT-6 depending on daylight savings time. I can be a little flexible on hours, but would usually like someone available from 9-5 or maybe 10-6 my time. Monday through Friday. Depending on experience, I'm willing to pay between $600 - $900 per month. Maybe more. A little about me... My desk is covered with stacks of papers - if you’re the right fit for this opening, your desk is clutter-free. I have to search to find anything (either electronic or paper) - if you’re the right fit for this opening, you know where everything is in your life. I regularly don’t reply in a timely way to correspondence, and it costs me money. And I hate checking email (but I have to). Do you love standard operating procedures? Great, because I don’t. Not only do I need help following them, but I also need help creating them. You should be one of those who doesn’t feel right if all correspondence is not replied to the same day it comes in. … all this being said, I’m a pretty successful real estate agent by many definitions. Not only am I a real estate agent, but also have a few successful websites. You will be occasionally asked to help out on those websites. Experience with Wordpress would be amazing, but I’m happy to train the right candidate. I’m an ideas person and would love to find someone that can help me execute on my ideas. And sometimes it might be helping launch a new business or website. Job Requirements A little more about the job... In this job, you will wear many hats. Your most IMPORTANT responsibility will be helping my buyers/sellers get from contract to close. What does that mean? I, as the real estate agent, will get the client under contract, and that’s when you take the lead. Documents and contracts are very important. You should be able to handle sending documents, reviewing them for accuracy, and making sure they get where they need to be. There are many important tasks with specific deadlines that need to be followed - you will make sure they are added to the calendar and completed. You will collaborate with clients as well as vendors and other real estate agents to ensure things are on track. Your top priority is to provide exceptional customer service throughout the entire closing process, not only our clients, but also to all parties involved. Another daily task is managing new leads into the website. The website gets about 3-7 leads per day. You will use the CRM to process the lead and set it up in our system. That involves categorizing it and setting up the lead to automatically receive real estate listings that match what they are looking for. You will be trained on all of this. Marketing will be another important responsibility. You will help me grow my business - whether it be updating websites, pulling lists of people to mail to, preparing newsletters, and more. You may be asked to write content. And you may be asked to design some flyers in Canva. Other common tasks include paying bills, adding transactions to Xero, updating status and info of existing leads in the CRM, and preparing listing appointment notes. I don’t have a big social media presence but I’m open to finding someone that help me with that aspect of the business. What does the ideal candidate look like? The ideal candidate must be adaptable to change and be solutions-oriented. This individual must provide a “can-do” attitude and will demonstrate initiative in problem-solving. You have a strong sense of urgency, but not at the expense of quality. In addition, you demonstrate on a daily basis the knowledge, attitudes, skills, and habits of a high achiever who is committed to putting clients first, doing the right thing. Strong English skills - speaking and writing are critical. You will occasionally be asked to have conversations with agents, clients, and leads. Some of the software I use (if you don’t have experience with some of these programs, don’t worry. I will provide training). Slack Gmail Google Docs / Sheets ToDoist Microsoft Word / Excel AirTable Dropbox Notion DotLoop - similar to DocuSign Canva WordPres Xero Daily Communication: We will mainly communicate via Slack. I’m very busy so I don’t do daily check-ins. If you are looking for a boss that is checking in with you several times a day, I’m not that person. I need someone that can work on there own and knows what needs to be done (once you are trained of course). In your application, please mention your favorite fruit. Benefits Paid U.S. Holidays Paid Vacation / Sick DaysSkills: Real Estate, Canva, Google Sheets, Administrative Support, Customer Service, Data Entry, Email Communication, Virtual Assistance, Customer Support, Communications
